title: Bug 3970 - UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files
description: Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX) the Windows work stations are used as X terminals and to run Eclipse (since PC are cheaper than Unix boxes).
OB: When creating a new file, the line delimiter currently used is returned from System.getProperties("line.delimiter"). However, this doesn't always meet user expectations.
EB: Even if the new file is created on Windows, it should have Unix line delimiters, since the end product is a Unix product. A UI (Preference) should be provided by the Workbench to define the line delimiter for new files. Possible values are: Dos/Windows, Mac, Unix, and default platform line delimiter. The UI should be consistent across all plugins to ensure the same line delimiter is used for new files.
SR:
1. Open Eclipse on a Windows workstation.
2. Create a new file.
3. Verify that the line delimiter used is the one returned from System.getProperties("line.delimiter").
4. Verify that there is no UI option to define the line delimiter for new files.
